text: Alfred Dreyfus (9 October 1859 â€“ 12 July 1935) was a French officer of Jewish descent. He was wrongly accused of treason against the French military. This scandal was known as the Dreyfus affair. He was imprisoned on Devil's Island in French Guiana. His highest rank was lieutenant colonel. Dreyfus was born in Mulhouse and died in Paris. == References == Category:1859 births Category:1935 deaths Category:Colonels Category:French Jews Category:French military people Category:French military personnel of World War I Category:French prisoners Category:Jewish military people Category:People from Mulhouse
title: Alfred Dreyfus
